messages.title: 60 Second Q&A with RICHARD GRAHAM
messages.content: Richard discusses his vision for Gloucester, which includes growth and study, more family houses, recycling more, attracting private sector investment, and hosting more sports events.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The need for more social housing, shared equity houses and retirement homes.
Improve local education with continuous work to make the new Academy a success and good results.

issues.education: Plans to keep up the good work at grammar schools and Barrwood to ensure good results and work to make the new Academy a success.
issues.environment: Richard Graham mentions recycling more and the loss of green field sites being a significant threat.
issues.health: Claims that Labour has talked of 8 million cuts in the NHS but really there are plans to increase NHS investment.

housing.content: Need for more social housing, shared equity houses, and retirement homes, without the loss of green field sites.

politicalExperience.achievements: Richard organized a 5,000 signature petition to save our MPâ€™s plan to keep the Control Tower building open for another two and two years behind plan.

contactInformation.address: Gloucester Conservatives, 1143 Regent Court, Gloucester Business Park, Gloucester, GL3 4AD.

quotes.text: Why we need change in Britain today

images.caption: Richard Graham interacting with people and engaged in various activities.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains personal messages from David Cameron, endorsements for changes in Britain, and a personal statement about commitment to the NHS and economy.
